forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere hums with a hint of melancholy as the afternoon drapes the city in a blanket of gray. The clouds loom heavy, softly enveloping the skyline, while the temperature meanders around a brisk fifty-eight degrees, nudging downwards. If you're venturing out, a light jacket will provide a comfort, allowing you to navigate the chill without succumbing to its bite. The air carries a whisper of moisture, foretelling the rain that will make its entrance later tonight, likely after ten, transforming the surroundings with its melodic patter.

As dusk approaches, the clouds deepen in their weightiness, and the promise of rainfall becomes more certain, a 90% chance hovering over the city. The south winds, with their lively gusts, are already stirring the streets, bringing with them the scent of the coming rain. This inherently wet weather invites you to indulge in quiet indoor pursuits—a leisurely visit to a cozy café with an artisan cup of coffee in hand or perhaps an exploration of one of the city's inviting bookstores, where time stands still wrapped in stories waiting to be discovered. As the evening unfolds, embrace the warmth of indoors, choosing to nestle into your favorite chair with a good book, while the rain serenades the city outside.
